int-org-section.heading: Press, Radio and Television

alt-heading.usage: casee ass mena sacac fea sasia eerca
casee ass sacac fea mena eerca sasia

address.verbatim-address: ave Carde, Immeuble CSS, 1 étage, BP 3237, Dakar, Senegal

org-entry.found-date: Nov. 2006, superseding the Union of National Radio and Television Organizations of Africa (f. 1962)
org-entry.content-note: co-ordinates radio and television services, including monitoring and frequency allocation, the exchange of information and coverage of national and international events among African countries
org-entry.stats: mems: 51 orgs and 6 assoc. mems

address.verbatim-address: IPPTAR Bldg, 2nd Floor, Angkasapuri, 50614 Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

org-entry.content-note: aims to foster and co-ordinate the devt of broadcasting in the region, to develop means of establishing closer collaboration and co-operation among broadcasting orgs, and to serve the professional needs of broadcasters in Asia and the Pacific
an ABU Media Academy was est. in 2020 to provide industry training and devt
holds an annual General Assembly and regular workshops and symposiums
org-entry.stats: mems: 246 in 65 countries and territories (incl. full, additional full, assoc., affiliate and institutional mems)
org-entry.content-note: publs ABU News (quarterly), ABU Technical Review (6 a year)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Association for the Promotion of International Circulation of the Press (DistriPress)

org-entry.content-note: aims to assist in the promotion of the freedom of the press throughout the world, supporting and aiding UNESCO in promoting the free flow of ideas
organizes meetings of publishers and distributors of newspapers, periodicals and paperback books, to promote the exchange of informa­tion and experience among mems
administers a DistriPress Training Foundation (online since 2019)
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 280 in some 70 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. Annual Report
aims to promote deeper knowledge of European problems and secure appreciation by the general public of the work of European institutions
to facilitate mems' access to sources of European information
and to defend the freedom of the press
org-entry.stats: mems: nat. asscns in 26 countries

org-entry.found-date: 1955 as European Cable Communications Association, present name adopted in 2006
org-entry.content-note: promotes the interests of the European cable industry and fosters co-operation among cos and national asscns
org-entry.stats: mems: 15 cos and 5 assoc. cos

address.verbatim-address: Caribbean Media Centre, Suite 1 b , Bldg 6 a , Harbour Industrial Estate, St Michael 11145, Barbados

org-entry.content-note: stimulating the flow of broadcast material among the radio and television systems in the Caribbean region
advocacy in regional and international forums on policy and technology issues
org-entry.stats: mems: 37 in 19 countries

org-entry.content-note: holds General Assembly every 2 years, Press Convention, workshops
mems: journalists' asscns in Brunei Darussalam, Indonesia, Lao People’s Democratic Rep., Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Viet Nam
observers: journalists' asscns in Cambodia and Myanmar
publs The ASEAN Journalist (quarterly), CAJ Yearbook

org-entry.found-date: 1957 as European Alliance of Press Agencies, present name adopted in 2002
org-entry.content-note: aims to promote co-operation among mems and to study and protect their common interests
annual assembly
org-entry.stats: mems: 33 news agencies

address.verbatim-address: CP 45, 17 a Ancienne-Route, 1218 Grand-Saconnex, Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: a professional asscn of broadcasting orgs, supporting the interests of mems and assisting the devt of broadcasting in all its forms
activities include the Eurovision news and programme exchanges, co-productions including the annual Eurovision Song Contest, and the Euroradio music ex­changes
org-entry.stats: mems: 112 orgs in 56 countries; 31 extraregional assoc. mems
org-entry.content-note: publs Annual Report , Technical Review (annually), tech-i (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: Maison de la Presse 5, rte de la Corniche 0, Médina, Dakar, Senegal

org-entry.content-note: defends the freedom of the press, and addresses professional issues affecting journalists

supports a network encompassing the West African Journalists Association, the Southern African Journalists Association, the Eastern African Journalists Association, the Association of Media Professionals Unions of Central Africa, and the Network of North African Journalists
promotes the freedom of the press in the Americas, and aims to uphold the highest standards in the profession
to foster a wider knowledge and greater interchange among the peoples of the Americas
org-entry.stats: mems: 1,300
org-entry.content-note: publ. IAPA News (monthly)
links national socs and represents the interests of two-way amateur radio communi­cation
org-entry.stats: mems: 160 nat. amateur radio socs

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote co-operation between the corpora­tions and public authorities
to defend freedom of expression
mems: 22 nat. asscns
publ. La Gaceta de AIR (every 2 months)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Sound and Audiovisual Archives

org-entry.content-note: supports the professional exchange of sound and audiovisual documents, and fosters international co-operation between audiovisual archives in all fields, in particular in the areas of acquisition, documentation, access, exploitation, copyright and preservation
org-entry.stats: mems: 400 individuals and institutions in 70 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. IASA Journal (2 a year)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Women in Radio and Television

org-entry.content-note: consultative status with the UN Economic and Social Council

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Council for Film, Television and Audiovisual Communication
org-entry-head.alt-name: Conseil international du cinema, de la télévision et de la communication audiovisuelle

org-entry.content-note: supports collaboration between UNESCO and professionals engaged in cinema, television and audiovisual communications
org-entry.stats: mems: 16 int. and 29 nat. and reg. film and television orgs

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Council of French-speaking Radio and Tele­vision Organizations
org-entry-head.alt-name: Conseil international des radios-télévisions d'ex­pres­sion française

org-entry.stats: mems: 50 orgs and 2 assoc. mems

org-entry-head.alt-name: Fédération Internationale de la Presse Cinématographique

org-entry.content-note: supports the cinematographic press and promotes cinema as an art
organizes international meetings and juries in film festivals
org-entry.stats: mems: nat. orgs in 56 countries and 66 individual mems

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Press Cutting Agencies (FIBEP)
org-entry-head.alt-name: Fédération Internationale des Bureaux d’Extraits de Presse

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote co-operation and best practices among media monitoring and analysis professionals
organizes workshops, networking meetings and the FIBEP World Media Intelligence Congress (51st Congress: Dublin, Ireland, in Sep. 2022)
org-entry.stats: mems: 110 corpns in more than 60 countries

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of the Periodical Press (FIPP)

org-entry.content-note: works for the benefit of magazine publishers around the world by promoting the common editorial, cultural and economic interests of consumer and business-to-business publishers, both in print and electronic media
fosters formal and informal alliances between magazine publishers and industry suppliers
organizes an annual World Media Congress (2024: Cascais, Portugal, in June)
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 50 nat. asscns, some 500 media owners and more than 150 supplier industries in 60 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. Innovation in Media World Report (annually)

address.verbatim-address: 155 rue de la Loi, 1040 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: aims to improve the working conditions of journalists and the quality of journalism through training progs and advocacy campaigns in the defence of rights related to the media

conducts international campaigns on journalists’ safety, press freedom, public service values, editorial independence, ethics, gender equality, children’s rights, tolerance and the right to decent working conditions
maintains 5 regional offices
org-entry.stats: mems: 187 trade unions and assocs in more than 140 countries

address.verbatim-address: Suite 107, 143 Kingston Rd, London, SW19 1LJ, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: supports all working in the field of communications, including policymakers, broadcasters, industrialists and engineers
holds local, regional and international meetings
undertakes research
publ. Intermedia (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: 71-75 Shelton St, London, WC2H 9JQ, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: aims to study and develop means of improving marine radio communications and radio aids to marine naviga­tion
org-entry.stats: mems: some 100 orgs and cos from 30 countries

org-entry.content-note: supports the principles of a free and responsible press
conducts research
maintains a library
holds regional meetings and an annual World Congress (2024: Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina, in May; a Media Innovation Festival was to be held at the same time)
org-entry.stats: mems: in 120 countries

address.verbatim-address: 25 Southampton Bldg, London, WC2A 1AL, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: aims to safeguard the telecommunications interests of the world press
acts as the news industry's formal standards body; meets 3 times a year and maintains 3 cttees and 4 working parties
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 60 news agencies, newspapers, news websites and industry vendors

address.verbatim-address: 12 ave de la Garem, 1003 Lausanne, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to enhance co-operation between mem. asscns
upholds the professional independence and common interests of sports journalists
org-entry.stats: mems: 160 asscns

org-entry.found-date: 2019 at the inaugural Global Conference for Media Freedom, organized by the UK and Canadian govts in London, UK, in July
org-entry.content-note: committed to upholding media freedom and the safety of journalists
promotes collaboration and the exchange of information among mem. signatories (of a Global Pledge on Media Freedom)
3rd Global Conf.: Tallinn, Estonia, in Feb. 2022
Co-Chairs in 2024: Estonia and Germany
org-entry.stats: mems: 50 countries

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote co-operation in professional matters and mutual exchange of news, features, etc. among the news agencies of Asia and the Pacific via the Asia-Pacific News Network
18th General Assembly: Tehran, Iran, in Oct. 2022
mems: 44 news agencies in 35 countries
regional press asscn
defends freedom of information and expression, promotes professional co-operation, provides training and education
merged with the Pacific Islands Broadcasting Association in 2004
org-entry.stats: mems: radio, television, newspapers, magazines, online services, nat. asscns and journalism schools in 23 countries and territories

address.verbatim-address: Arts 1.80, University of East Anglia, Norwich, NR4 7TJ, United Kingdom

org-entry.found-date: 1945 as the Commonwealth Broadcasting Association; present name adopted in 2014
org-entry.content-note: aims to strengthen and enhance public service broadcasting; promotes the exchange of knowledge and best practice in public media
established a Global Task Force in 2020 to defend and uphold the values of the public service media (PSM) worldwide
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 100 in more than 54 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. PSM Weekly

org-entry.usage: ewyb edio eerca mena ass fea
org-entry.content-note: aims to defend press freedom throughout the world
generates awareness of violations of press freedoms and supports journalists under threat or imprisoned as a result of their work

updates annually a Press Freedom Index: topped in 2023 by Norway, while the 10 countries deemed to have least press freedom were Bahrain (placed 171 of 180), Cuba, Myanmar, Eritrea, the Syrian Arab Rep., Turkmenistan, Iran, Viet Nam, China, and (placed last) Democratic People’s Rep. of Korea
records the deaths of journalists and other media workers killed or imprisoned in connection to their work

has 134 correspondents worldwide, and, in addition to the HQ in Paris, 7 offices, in Brussels (Belgium), Rio de Janeiro (Brazil), Dakar (Senegal), Taipei (Taiwan), Tunis (Tunisia), London (UK) and Washington, DC (USA)
org-entry.stats: mems in 150 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Annual Report , La Lettre de Reporters sans Frontières (6 a year)

address.verbatim-address: IFJ Asia-Pacific, 245 Chalmers St, Redfern, Sydney, NSW 2016, Australia

org-entry.found-date: 2004 as an alliance of journalists’ unions and press asscns to promote the freedom of expression, association and journalists’ rights in the South Asia region
org-entry.content-note: aims to establish regional support and foster stronger trade practice to promote fair working conditions, human rights, diversity and editorial independence
co-ordinated by the International Federation of Journalists (IFJ Asia-Pacific)
org-entry.stats: mems: press asscns and journalists’ unions in Afghanistan, Bhutan, Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, Sri Lanka

address.verbatim-address: 9 Lower Ground, Eden Heights, Jail Rd, Lahore, Pakistan

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote regional co-operation through information networks and media services
encourages professional co-operation and media devt while sustaining social initiatives, media ethics and the freedom of expression of the media
recognized as a SAARC affiliated body
promotes and protects press freedoms in South, East and Central Europe
org-entry.stats: mems: 2,800 individuals

org-entry.content-note: promotes quality public broadcasting
facilitates training of broadcasters at all levels
co-ordinates broadcasting activities in the SADC region
organizes radio news exchange service
produces television and radio progs

address.verbatim-address: 308 Main St, Toronto, ON M4C 4X7, Canada

org-entry.found-date: 1975 to promote human dignity, justice and peace through freedom of expression and the democratization of communication
org-entry.content-note: offers professional guidance on communication policies
interprets devts in and the consequences of global communication methods
promotes the empowerment of women
assists the training of Christian communicators
org-entry.stats: mems: 1,500 corp. and personal mems in 120 countries, organized in 8 reg. asscns
org-entry.content-note: publs Newsletter (10 a year), Media Development (quarterly), Communication Rights

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: World Association of Newspapers and News Publishers (WAN-IFRA)

org-entry.found-date: 2009 by merger of World Association of Newspapers (f. 1948) and IFRA (f. 1961)
org-entry.content-note: WAN-IFRA is the worldwide service and representative org. of newspapers and the entire news publishing industry
aims to support this industry, as well as its technology and service
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 3,000 cos in 120 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs WAN-IFRA Magazine (2 a year, and online), World Press Trends (database)
brings together professionals working in radio, television, cinema, video, media education, internet and digital technology
holds World Congress every 4 years (2026: Kigali, Rwanda)
org-entry.stats: mems: 100 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Annual Report , SIGNIS Media (3 a year)
